platform.game.button

Class Spawn

  • java.lang.Object
    • platform.game.Actor
      • platform.game.block.Block
        • platform.game.button.Button
          • platform.game.button.Spawn
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Actor>

    public class Spawn
extends Button
    Spawn is a class that Spawns actors. Used in level.Builder. It has a specificity for the Player, in that it only spawns it effectively after a second left click.

    All Actors other than Player are instantly instantiated. It is done so because Player moves the camera, which is actively used to build the level beforehand.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      private Actor actor
      Spawns the Actor stored in this variable
      private Box boxOrigin
      Used to maintain the spawn in focus in the level, even when moving.
      private Actor newActor
      Is used to track the newly created Actor
      private static long serialVersionUID 
      private Actor sourceSprite
      Sprite of an actor that is in collision with the spawn
      private java.util.ArrayList<Actor> toUnregister
      Is used to unregister all Actors (mainly SuperSpawners) from the level

    • Constructor Detail

      • Spawn

        public Spawn(Box box,
             java.lang.String spriteOff,
             java.lang.String spriteOn,
             Actor actor,
             java.util.ArrayList<Actor> toUnregister,
             int shortcut)
        Full constructor used to Spawn the Player.
        Parameters:
        box - Position and size parameters of the Spawn.
        spriteOff - Sprite of the Button when the mouse is not on it.
        spriteOn - Sprite of the Button when the mouse is on it.
        actor - Actor linked to the Spawn.
        toUnregister - List of Actors that need to be unregistered. That marks the Spawn as being the Player's.
        shortcut - Shortcut of the Spawn.
        See Also:
        KeyEvent
